meanings.definition: Exceptional acuteness or sensitivity in a particular sense or function.
meanings.sent1: Her hyperacuity in hearing allowed her to detect the faintest sounds.
meanings.sent2: His hyperacuity in vision enabled him to see tiny insects from far away.
meanings.sent3: The hyperacuity of the detective's sense of smell helped him solve the mystery.
meanings.sent4: The hyperacuity of the microscope revealed intricate details in the specimen.
meanings.sent5: The hyperacuity of the radar system detected the smallest objects in the sky.

meanings.definition: The ability to perceive minute differences or details.
meanings.sent1: The artist's hyperacuity allowed her to notice subtle shades of color in the painting.
meanings.sent2: His hyperacuity in taste made him a great chef, able to distinguish the finest ingredients.
meanings.sent3: The hyperacuity of the tailor's eye for measurements ensured a perfect fit every time.
meanings.sent4: The hyperacuity of the scientist's observations led to groundbreaking discoveries.
meanings.sent5: The hyperacuity of the security camera captured every movement with precision.
